projects.title: Below the Surface AR
projects.description: Deadly legal fishing methods are killing thousands of dolphins every year. Below the Surface AR immerses you in the shocking reality of bycatch.
projects.role: Concept, Creative Direction, Design, Development, 3D, Sound Design & Composition, Sponsor

data.title: The Concept
data.body: Below the Surface aims to raise awareness of the true horrors of commercial fishing bycatch by using the immersive power of AR. Made with Jelly, Resn’s industry-leading real-time Web3D pipeline, the experience lets you see the reality of bycatch on a mobile device.

data.title: The Challenge
data.body: In 2019 alone, over 11,000 dolphins were killed as bycatch off the west coast of France. Our challenge was to shine a light on what bycatch really is: the brutal extermination of sea life.

data.title: A Tranquil Beginning
data.body: The experience begins with a beautiful sphere of water floating in front of you. A fishing boat cruises its surface. As you zoom in, you are transported to a pristine undersea world.

data.title: A Deadly End
data.body: Floating in front of you is a dolphin struggling in a net. From every direction, you can hear the sounds of dolphins in distress. A fishing boat passes overhead and hauls the dolphins out of the water before dumping their dead bodies overboard. This is bycatch.

data.title: A Call to Action
data.body: To finish, a bold CTA invites you to donate to Sea Shepherd to help end dolphin slaughter. It doesn’t have to be this way, but the change starts on your plate.

data.title: Creating an Underwater Environment
data.body: Jelly allowed us to realistically render an underwater environment in real-time 3D. We used a combination of VFX techniques, such as volumetric lights, distance fog, caustics and micro-particles, to simulate real physical behaviours. We applied a similar approach to the sphere of water to create its ocean surface and water disturbance effects.

data.title: AR Elements
data.body: Our simulated AR approach used the gyroscope to synchronise the position of the sphere of water with the user’s phone movements. To convincingly blend our 3D render with the user’s environment, we simulated light reflections on the water’s surface by extracting colors from the users camera feed. These techniques allowed us to approximate an AR experience inside a mobile browser.

projects.title: Corn. Revolutionized.
projects.description: A look at the cutting-edge science behind Pioneer corn told through the choreography of real-time 3D assets and animation.

data.title: The Challenge
data.body: Resn & Bader Rutter teamed up to create a revolutionary online experience that tells the story of how Pioneer develops new varieties of corn. We wanted to captivate our audience with stunning imagery of the development process and turn skeptics into believers.

data.title: A life cycle
data.body: We wrapped experience in an infinite loop to represent the cycle of nature—from seed to plant and back to seed again—with some data and DNA added along the way.

data.title: The Experience
data.body: Using our 3D pipeline Jelly, we combine high-end visuals with a slick UI and engaging interactions to create an experience that highlights the unique properties of a Pioneer seed.

data.title: Different Conditions
data.body: To further highlight the strengths of the Pioneer corn, we showed the plant withstanding different weather conditions corn is forced to endure throughout the growing season.

data.title: Scenes in Jelly
data.body: Our Jelly pipeline allowed us to compose stunning animated scenes that combine 2D assets, 3D models and interactive elements without forcing users to endure long load times.

data.title: 3D Projection mapping
data.body: By projecting high-level textures onto simplified 3D meshes we could give the sense of fully immersive 3D while still keeping it light on the CPU.

data.title: User Interface
data.body: The user interface was designed to be slick and elegant while highlighting Pioneer’s technological prowess. We kept it simple but sophisticated with some unique interactions.

data.title: The Result
data.body: The result was an endlessly looping, best-in-class 3D experience that demonstrates the benefits and technology of Pioneer corn.

projects.title: Jelly - Realtime 3D Pipeline
projects.description: Jelly is Resn’s Web3D pipeline: our in-house production and development methodology that allows us to deliver premium real-time 3D that fits your budget.

data.title: Blazing Trails
data.body: Jelly propels real-time 3D into the future. Over the last 10 years, we’ve built the framework and capabilities that allow us to achieve a level of quality and performance that wasn’t thought possible—until now.

data.title: Superior Quality
data.body: Jelly can achieve unparalleled photorealism with convincing depth of field, dynamic lighting and thousands of animated particles. And we do it while maintaining consistent stroke widths and smooth edges regardless of screen size or pixel density.

data.title: In short, Jelly delivers the highest-quality Web3D out there.
Lower Overhead
data.body: Jelly’s pipeline is robust and efficient, enabling Resn’s experienced developers to navigate complex workflows with ease. Compared to similar offerings, Jelly means lower overheads and shortened production schedules.

data.title: With Jelly, you get more for less.
Unparalleled Performance
data.body: Jelly delivers a premium-quality result without sacrificing performance. We minimize render passes and draw calls with optimized techniques, such as combining high-res 3D assets with baked-in visual effects, to produce superior results with minimal load times.

data.title: With Jelly, you won’t lose their attention.
AR Ready
data.body: The field of WebAR is in its infancy, but the possibilities are incredibly exciting. We’ve developed our own AR workflow, JellyJAR, and we’ve already achieved some amazing results.

items.text: Interactions enhance customer experience for deeper understanding and connection.
Customers build personalized products online, with instant visualization.
JellyJAR experience reveals product features using Z-Depth movement.
Explore complex or technical products by layering information intuitively.
Customers connect with the product through engaging AR interactions.

projects.title: LES MILLS GRIT
projects.description: LES MILLS GRIT, high impact cross platform advertising spots for the intense HIIT workout program.
projects.role: Art Direction, Design, Animation, Editing, Sound Design

data.title: The Challenge
data.body: Our challenge was to produce a high volume of advertising spots and infuse them with the same spirit as a real GRIT workout to inspire people to take on the GRIT challenge.

data.title: Grid Layout
data.body: A consistent set of proportional grids across the entire campaign formed the backbone of the design. This purposeful layout meant the eye could track the active type, even at its most energetic.

data.title: Dynamic Visual Style
data.body: An array of dynamic images, deformations, pixel glitches and textures produced a vibrant visual style. From a beating 3D heart to flickering pixel glitches, our visual tookit added layers of technical detail to our compositions.

data.title: Gritty Sound Design
data.body: We built the strong, textural sound design around recordings of a real GRIT class. The variety of rhythms worked together as a full piece or broken into smaller sections. This modular approach games us flexibility while preserving the distinctive GRIT sound.

projects.title: Discover Lexus
projects.description: Discover Lexus is a home for Lexus to communicate its many amazing stories that go well beyond the automotive.

awards.name: User's Choice Site of the Year
Webby Award Winner - Car Sites & Car Culture

data.title: The Challenge
data.body: Resn and Saatchi & Saatchi Tokyo teamed up to reimagine how Lexus engaged with users online. Our challenge was to streamline their digital comms and give users a broader appreciation for all things Lexus.

data.title: Experience Amazing
data.body: We began the project with a deep dive into digital strategy. Our aim was to create a cohesive experience from multiple Lexus brand activities for a clearer vision with more valuable content.

data.title: Flexible Approach
data.body: Our flexible CMS makes it easy to create engaging stories with a bespoke level of polish. The system uses different modules to add new content and structure it appropriately. This quick content-creation and management system allows Lexus to stay current with less effort.

data.title: The Result
data.body: The result was a site that was welcoming, yet bold; simple, yet sophisticated; easy to navigate, yet rich in content. We wrapped it all in an elegant design with fluid motion that lets the content shine and users Experience Amazing.

projects.title: adidas Futurecraft.Loop Event
projects.description: The adidas Futurecraft.Loop launch event in New York City brought together 200 handpicked influencers from around the world. From here, they started their journey as the first ever generation of adidas’ groundbreaking product movement.

data.title: THE RECYCLABLE PRODUCT
data.body: adidas Futurecraft.Loop is a 100% recyclable product where the shoes are made from a single TPU material. They can be worn, ground up and then melted back down into the raw material, eventually being turned into brand new shoes. This global product launch was a one-time, invite-only event in New York for a select group of 200 people.

data.title: The Venue
data.body: The Duggal Greenhouse was selected as the venue for the Loop Event, situated in the Brooklyn Navy Yard in NYC. Chosen for its sheer impressive size and focus on sustainability, the space provided a perfect canvas to house our large-scale projection mapping set up.

data.title: VISUALS LEAD BY PROJECTION
data.body: As Futurecraft.Loop is focused on reducing wastefulness, it was of utmost importance to create an event with minimal fabrication, relying instead on projection and suspended projection surfaces to define zones within the venue. Two main areas were created, both tying in conceptually to the product where our linear product economy must lead to a circular one.

data.title: Entry Projection Tunnel
data.body: After arriving and checking in to the venue, guests first enter a linear tunnel surrounded by nine large projection surfaces, on all sides as well as the roof. This entry point sets the scene for the current issues on plastic waste and purpose for the creation of Futurecraft.Loop.

data.title: AUDIO-VISUAL EXPERIENCE
data.body: Custom audio and voice overs, playing alongside large-scale, high intensity animated graphics and typography create an impressive venue entrance. Statistics, copy and 3D assets present the world’s issues on plastic waste in a bold, easy to understand way.

data.title: THE TUNNEL DOORWAY
data.body: Situated at the end of the projection tunnel was a small doorway with smoke effects hiding the main circular projection area beyond. After guests walk through the doorway one by one, they find themselves walking into a circular formation together.

data.title: Guests Enter The Circle
data.body: The 200 guests now enter a circular space with three layers of 360° suspended projection surfaces creating a layering of visuals. Custom 360° audio was designed and synced to the video that’s playing.

data.title: VIDEO CONTENT
data.body: While guests waited for the countdown to end before speakers came on-stage, ambient graphics, messaging, branding and video content set the scene for what was to come. Taking advantage of transparency within the middle projection surface allowed physical layering opportunities with how the video interacts together.

data.title: VIDEO EFFECTS
data.body: All video footage was treated and edited in ways which portrayed the product concept of a continuous loop. Techniques such as repetition and frame delays are shown below.

data.title: Keynote Speeches
data.body: Willow Smith partnered with adidas and Futurecraft.Loop, speaking first on stage before top adidas spokespeople revealed the product and explained the thinking and work that went into its design.

data.title: THE SPEAKERS
data.body: Eric Liedtke, CMO at adidas revealed the physical shoe product on stage before Paul Gaudio, adidas’ Global Creative Director discussed Futurecraft and the work that went into creating a fully recyclable product. Each topic in the speeches contained custom video content displayed on all surfaces that was switched in real-time via Resn direction.

data.title: ANIMATED BACKDROPS
data.body: Large scale animated backdrops were projected behind the speakers using a mixture of photography and 3D assets. Various techniques such as that shown below were used to create subtle movement on the imagery.

data.title: Shoe Reveal & Physical Displays
data.body: After the speeches concluded, 200 pairs of shoes suspended in the ceiling were lowered to the ground in a surprise moment. Guests were then invited to meet and talk with adidas designers who worked on the product and explore physical materials and prototype displays.

data.title: BAGS & DISPLAYS
data.body: Each bag was pre-filled with the guests specific shoe sizes and were located via a number from 1-200. Multiple stations around the space contained a variety of physical TPU materials to explore that showcased different stages of the production process. Video content was also created as a backdrop for these stations to provide deeper information.

data.title: VISUALISING THE PROCESS
data.body: 3D animations visualised the different steps in the manufacturing process, showing how the TPU material changes form.

data.title: Resn Content Creation
data.body: Resn handled the design, animation, editing and asset management for all projected video content in-house. A significant amount of content was created to play for the two hour event duration with the very high resolution video split across multiple projectors.

data.title: A LOOP FROM PHYSICAL TO WEB
data.body: Each pair of shoes came with a QR code printed on the tongue to allow guests to link out to the web hub. From here they explored deeper information about the technology and product. The site was designed and built by Resn — https://www.adidas.co.uk/futurecraft

data.title: Immersive Journey
data.body: Travel through a world built out of moody environments, cryptic graphics and hidden messages.

data.title: Dema
data.body: To create the metaphorical city of Dema in 3D we leveraged the brutalist architectiure taken from the life action music video, recreating a perfect virtual version.

data.title: Plains
data.body: Within the plains are a series of interactive “portals” that are connected to similar wide open landscapes. This creates a maze where the user feels the dichotomy of being lost while at the same time feeling in control of the path they choose.

data.title: Banditøs
data.body: We created interactive silhouettes giving users the power to uncover the iconic floral patterns and yellow tape associated with the Banditø uniform. This simple encounter revealed the mysterious shadows to be friends not foes.

data.title: Hills
data.body: A vast open landscape with hills and plateaus that users can decide to manipulate, controlling the landform by clicking anywhere to create or destroy hills. Like the Plains, this scene offers a series of “portals” that are connected to similar landscapes.

data.title: Gorge
data.body: At the end of the final chapter, the Gorge, users discover the Banditø camp. At this point full 360 degrees control of the camera becomes available, representing the free mind. The user continues past the camp and onwards down a neverending pathway.

data.title: Fan Share
data.body: Fans received a uniquely generated Banditø badge by connecting with their Spotify account.

data.title: Encrypted Symbols
data.body: Lots of metaphors and cryptic graphics were incorporated into the experience. To satisfy the curiosity of TØP’s very dedicated fanbase we placed five hidden symbols throughout the experience. Since the release of the album the meanings of these five symbols have been a mystery to the fans. Upon finding the symbols the user gathers “secret” documents that explain the meaning of each.

projects.title: Hellboy – Join the B.P.R.D.
projects.description: Join Hellboy at the B.P.R.D. Browse the agency’s secret archives and have an A.I.-powered conversation with the real Hellboy.

data.title: Hellboy Wants You!
data.body: Resn partnered with Lionsgate to create a unique mobile promotion for the Hellboy film, by recruiting you into Hellboy’s secret agency.

data.title: Got What It Takes?
data.body: When you apply for a job, Hellboy calls to interview you. The conversation is powered by an A.l. engine with voice-acting by Hellboy actor David Harbour.

data.title: B.P.R.D. Archive
data.body: Browse selected dossiers from the B.P.R.D. archive, including personnel files of characters from the film.

data.title: Operating System
data.body: Inspired by intelligence documents from the 1950s, the archive looks like a clandestine operating system lost in time. Sensitive material has been carefully redacted—until you land the job.

data.title: Give ‘Em Hell
data.body: The site launched on ‘Hellboy Day, celebrating the 25th Anniversary of the first Hellboy comic. The experience received the coveted seal of approval from the hardcore Hellboy fan base and introduced brand new fans to the Hellboy universe.

projects.title: adidas Alphaedge4D Event
projects.description: The AlphaEdge4D launch event in Tokyo, Shanghai, and New York was a multi-purpose space to introduce the AlphaEdge4D shoe, explain it’s lattice designed mid-sole through interactive installations, and showcase their technology via educational videos, live interviews and print collateral.

data.title: Floorplan
data.body: The overall floor plan follows a rectangular shape with modular areas. Guests enter from the bottom and move their way up to the end studio space.

data.title: Data & Design
data.body: The Data and Design section showcased content related to data capture, sports science and the design of the lattice mid-sole structure and it’s different densities.

data.title: Lattice Models
data.body: Physical models were created to explain pressure data and the lattice support structure. These sat next to the final midsole to show the design progression.

data.title: Midsole Scanner
data.body: A cutting edge physical and digital interactive installation allowed guests to explore the AlphaEdge4D midsole through 'x-ray' vision.

data.title: Screen Interface
data.body: The screen in front of the physical scanner box reacts in real time to the handle movement. By moving the physical handles back and forth, a screen in-front of them scrubs through hundreds of real CT scan images of the lattice interior.

data.title: LED Interactive Wall
data.body: The LED wall was a large scale multiple-user experience, giving the guests the ability to explore the lattice and it’s energy return in a fun, engaging, insta-worthy way.

data.title: Lattice Design
data.body: Using body tracking, the visitors position influences the visuals (a representation of the midsole's design and behaviour) allowing full control of a lattice mesh and the ability to experience 'Controlled Energy'.

data.title: Plinth
data.body: Our event plinths featured a triangular white metal frame with clear perspex sides and adidas / AlphaEdge branding. Underneath the green base plate was a set of LED lights.

projects.title: Airbnb - More of Less
projects.description: Airbnb - More of Less invites you to visit a traditional rural village where time-honoured practices are cultivated for the next generation.

data.title: The Challenge
data.body: Our challenge was to recreate the sights, sounds and ambience of a rural Chinese village on a mobile phone as authentically as possible.

data.title: Bringing a Village to Life
data.body: We visited a traditional rural village to get a sense of the day-to-day life of the local community. We used our first-hand knowledge to generate five storylines that embodied essential aspects of village life.

data.title: Art Direction
data.body: We crafted a design language that combined traditional and contemporary watercolour painting and brought the village to life with over 300 hand-painted scenes, animated in a 3D environment.

data.title: Familiar UX
data.body: The UX needed to be easy and familiar, so we used one simple mechanic: the scroll. The familiarity of the UX allowed the user to focus exclusively on the beautiful imagery and story, creating a captivating mobile experience.

projects.title: Kekubian Assassin
projects.description: A digital companion piece to Terence Nance’s new HBO show, Random Acts of Flyness. With only one hand, this mobile first-person shooter has you helping Najja fend off the nonsense by throwing shade at anyone trying to steal her joy.

data.title: Gameplay
data.body: This violence-adverse first-person shooter has you firing off scowls, not guns, at any agressive NPC's you encounter. With a smart, modular world-building architecture one gaming experience is never the same.

data.title: Creating Worlds
data.body: The game is an endless runner taking place in four environments in Brooklyn: Street, Dive bar, Park, and Bodega. All environmental objects were sculpted in-house and positioned using the world-building tool.

data.title: Environments
data.body: All the environments created were done in collaboration with the showrunner and had one foot in the reality of Brooklyn while the other was drenched in the hyper-fantasy of a Neo-Egyptian mythology.

projects.title: Time for a Mammogram
projects.description: Real families affected by breast cancer share their stories in an audio-animated journey that reminds us a mammogram gives a better chance of survival.

data.title: The Challenge
data.body: Our challenge was to create a thoughtful and compelling digital experience that shows how the effects of breast cancer spread through the community.

data.title: We’re all Affected
data.body: Using interviews with real people affected by breast cancer, we paired audio clips with animations of dividing cells. New cells, representing family and friends, split from the original, representing the cancer sufferer.

data.title: Carefully Considered Design
data.body: The experience was built on a two-tone colour palette with clean, evocative shapes and simple interactions. The design brought the stories into sharp focus while stressing the importance of getting a mammogram.

data.title: Results:
data.body: The campaign reached 79% of all Kiwis. During October Awareness Month, more women booked a mammogram than ever before, making it New Zealand’s most successful mammogram awareness drive.

projects.title: adidas Speedfactory Activation
projects.description: A globally touring activation showcasing adidas' high-tech, data-driven footwear and its manufacturing process.

data.title: Speedfactory
data.body: Speedfactory is an innovative concept from adidas, a manufacturing revolution where high speed customised footwear can be produced in more localised factories in a largely automated robotic driven process.

data.title: AM4
data.body: Trialling this process with unique designs made for six key cities, the AM4 shoe is the showpiece of the activation.

data.title: The Brief
data.body: adidas approached Resn with the brief to create an event space, housing multiple installations that spoke to the three key messaging aspects of Speedfactory.

data.title: Innovation
data.body: adidas' cutting-edge manufacturing, data collection/analysis, and production techniques are second to none. Our installs should use similar innovative data collection practices and hardware.

data.title: Co-Creation
data.body: All Speedfactory products are borne from real athlete captured data. This meant all of our interactives should extrapolate the visitors’ data in some manner and produce something different in combination with adidas collateral.

data.title: Speed
data.body: These products are produced at least 20x faster than conventional production and getting faster! All of our interactive content would be either visualised immediately or downloaded to their device within seconds.

data.title: Sign Up / Create / Save: The Mobile App
data.body: The lynchpin to the activation process was the web app we created for all visitors to log in to.

data.title: Personal Barcode
data.body: Once they did, a unique barcode was created for them - a tool by which they could activate any of the installations inside, enter digital queues, create something and then it would automatically download that content to their wallet within seconds.

data.title: Zone One: The Kinect Entrance
data.body: A playful digital mirror using Kinects (a Speedfactory-used technology) illustrates how truly painless it is for your physical data to be captured. A wall of screens visualises your physical presence, progressing from simple raw data through to a more human form.

data.title: Zone Two: Face Scan Booths
data.body: Three separate booths, each with two DSLRs and a touchscreen. Once scanned in, the creator was invited to take a picture of themselves.

data.title: Face Scan Booths
data.body: Within seconds, we had tracked their facial features and incorporated their image into three unique pieces of adidas branded content. We also integrated user-submitted personal data as well as data specific to that location.

data.title: Zone Three: Foot Scanners
data.body: Via a custom Resn-made iPad controller we could control two scanners at one time.

data.title: Foot Scanners
data.body: Multiple lasers would register each contour of the creators’ feet and send us the correct data points to make a fully accurate 3D model, while also providing exact dimensions of their foot. A singular size comparison takeaway was created for each visitor.

data.title: Zone Four: The Run Test (Treadmill)
data.body: The centrepiece of the activation and the accumulation of all messaging pillars, here the creator was captured running on a treadmill (wearing the new product) by a Kinect and several DSLRs.

data.title: Run Test Output
data.body: A couple of minutes later a unique video was sent to their app, with their actual running data, skeletal tracking, and adidas branding baked in. As demand was higher with only one person allowed in the room at a time, Resn created a digital queuing system that notified the creator when it was their turn removing the need for a physical line.

data.title: Zone Five: The AM4 Showcase (Plinths)
data.body: The story about the AM4's design for each city was pretty rich. Product benefits were different for each key city - patch placement was dictated by runner data from that particular location - even the colours chosen reflected key attributes of the environment.

data.title: AM4 Showcase
data.body: In this section, we explored all those influences, with assets pasted, hung or mounted throughout and showed the products themselves centre stage, alongside their other city counterparts.

data.title: City to City Evolution
data.body: adidas wanted the activation to seem like it was in constant flux—Always in Beta.

data.title: Always in Beta
data.body: On the exterior and interior, our design leveraged a skeletal like scaffold system (one that is used in the Speedfactory plant) which we accented with Plexi and lights in the same palette as the shoe for that city. In the AM4 section itself, we curated some of the previous city content and left that in place - a living document of the past iterations against the new cities hero shoe.

projects.title: KFC Chickendales
projects.description: KFC Chickendales creates a personalised video for your mother on Mother’s Day starring a muscular Colonel Sanders and the world-famous Chippendales dancers.

data.title: The Challenge
data.body: Wieden+Kennedy wanted a shareable video experience that could be customized for every mother.

data.title: The Right Ingredients
data.body: The project needed a scalable digital solution that could quickly create a dynamically-edited and rendered video. Resn’s recently enhanced interactive video platform, Cake, provided just the right tools.

data.title: Cake Dynamic
data.body: Cake Dynamic is Cake’s cloud-based rendering and editing tool that integrates a personalised name and location into each video. It receives user information from the custom-built microsite then reorders, sorts, and chooses shots for the final video.

data.title: Variety Pack
data.body: We worked closely with director Kyle Sauer to create a locked edit where alternative shots were equal in length and interchangeable. This provided variation between videos while guaranteeing the edit remained synced to the music.

data.title: Sharing the Love
data.body: Videos could be shared on Facebook and Twitter or downloaded directly. Users logged over a million sessions and created 300k videos with a peak submission rate of 5.5k videos per minute. I mean, who needs flowers when you have a sexy Colonel Sanders, amirite?

projects.title: Nordy Portrait
projects.description: Take your picture and turn it into an illustrated Nordy Portrait for The Nordy Club, Nordstrom's new customer loyalty program.

data.title: Computer vision based API
data.body: Our Backend API converts user's photos into illustrations. We used a number of different computer vision techniques for the API: 1. Face feature detection for the eyes, eyebrows, nose and mouth. 2. An algorithm to detect the edges of a face. 3. An algorithm to detect eyebrow position, hairline and hair boundaries. 4. An algorithm to detect the neckline.

data.title: Customized sharable content
data.body: We then packaged the content through a custom set-up that generated the correct image and video formats for all social media channels. This included a custom back-end flow to generate animated customized videos for Instagram.

projects.title: FAFSWAGVOGUE
projects.description: An Interactive Documentary taking you into the LGBTQ+ vogue ball scene in the world’s biggest Pacific city.

data.title: Gaming Methodology
data.body: FAFSWAGVOGUE is an online documentary that uses a gaming methodology, drawing the audience into the story through intuitive interactions while they learn about vogue culture. Users can choose striking characters and locations to judge a unique dance battle. Selecting a winner will unlock short-form documentaries, revealing the personal lives of five performers.

data.title: Involving the Audience
data.body: After a short introduction, users enter a custom 360° environment, where they can select a performer and location for a dance battle. During the battle, users can tap-and-hold to enable slow motion, allowing them to explore each moment in greater detail. These interactive elements allow users to control aspects of the experience, involving them in the story and allowing them to play an active role throughout.

data.title: Tap & Hold
data.body: On mobile, the gyroscope enabled menu navigation and tap-and-hold interactions. For desktop, the experience takes full advantage of the larger screen size with higher-res images, while navigation is accomplished through intuitive interactions like click-and-drag.

projects.title: Pocket Mustang
projects.description: Unleash your inner Mustang, anywhere.

data.title: Feel Like a Kid Again
data.body: We worked with GTB Shanghai to give users the feeling of being a kid again, by using their phones like a toy Mustang.

data.title: From Mobile to Mustang
data.body: To turn a user's mobile phone into a Ford Mustang, we need to track the phone's movement. We gather data from the phone's gyroscope, which measures rotation, and the accelerometer, which tracks linear acceleration.

data.title: Real-Time Drifting
data.body: By analysing the motion path of the phone and changes in device rotation and acceleration, we can generate a map of a virtual race track and reconstruct the Mustang's manoeuvres, in real-time.

data.title: Achievement Unlocked
data.body: Users can unlock badges by doing sweet tricks like Fishtails, Donuts and Figure 8s. There are nine badges in total, but only the best will unlock them all. We also stuck in a few sarcastic Easter Eggs for anyone who has trouble drifting their phone. GiT GuD... XD

data.title: Your Moves, Real Mustang
data.body: We spent two days filming World Champion drifter Vaughn Gittin Jr. driving a Mustang around Ford's Arizona Proving Grounds. Using this footage, we dynamically assemble a shareable, custom video of Vaughn replicating the user's moves in his aggressive, foot-to-the-floor, big-smoke driving style.

projects.title: Resn's Little HelpAR
projects.description: Resn’s Little HelpAR is an update of a very Resn yuletide tradition. This year in trembling anticipation for AR on the Web we forged a new experience that was built on the last, one which tips a bell- festooned hat to the emerging world of augmented browser experiences.

data.title: Faux AR
data.body: Determined to create an Augmented Reality experience for all, we built one for the mobile browser.

data.title: Jethro's back!
data.body: Left his house. Warm jacket. More real than ever before.

data.title: Shrooms
data.body: Find the shrooms and see yourself through Jethro's eyes.

data.title: Portals
data.body: Enter different worlds and browse galleries with a brand-new interaction we coined the ‘sloppy lock’.

projects.title: Interactive Retail Shoe
projects.description: An activation that was included in the Speedfactory launch events and installed in flagship stores. Users navigated a 3D model of the latest AM4 shoe on a screen in front of them, using an actual AM4 shoe quipped with a custom-made sensor hidden in its sole.
projects.role: Creative concept, Development, Product Design, and Fabrication Management

data.title: Summary
data.body: We modified a trainer shoe with a built in gyroscope empowering retail visitors to pick up the product and explore its features and content on a large display screen in realtime.

data.title: 1:1 effect
data.body: The position and orientation of the actual shoe perfectly matched its on-screen version. Users were able to hold and move the shoe, triggering one of five hotspots placed around the model and displaying the corresponding product feature on the screen.

data.title: Charging Shoe Stand
data.body: The stand was designed to house an inductive charging system which recharged the shoe when it was placed back into position. Meaning a clean, cable-free, and premium product.

projects.title: Rip Ready
projects.description: adidas Athletics asked us to design and build a tool that gave key athletes and influencers the ability to create beautiful, custom sharable videos for Instagram.

data.title: Web App Tool
data.body: We created a tool with a deceptively simple user question flow. From the individual responses we created a unique piece of content which included hypnotic and dynamic text animations related to the user’s input. They could also upload a short video of themselves with the product to add that personal touch.

data.title: Custom Sharable Videos
data.body: Once submitted the back-end generates custom content at lightning speed. The high end UGC is then emailed to the influencers in both the Story and Post format, ready to be shared out on their social channels.

projects.title: HP Sound in Color
projects.description: Capture any piece of audio on your Android handheld or desktop and transform it into a lush, abstract piece of art.

data.title: HP Reinvent Giving
data.body: Created as part of the HP Reinvent Giving campaign, 'Sound in Color' allows users to capture audio or a voice message via their mobile or computer, turning the sound frequencies into an abstract piece of art. This artwork could then be shared, printed on paper or even a real piece of canvas.

data.title: Audio Analysis
data.body: After receiving an audio input from an Android device or desktop microphone, we analysed the various frequencies assigning colours and brushes to different frequency brackets. After making these calculations, we then divided the creation process into a two step sequence; creating the background and then applying brush strokes to the canvas.

data.title: Step 1: Background Creation
data.body: The first step was laying down a colourful background layer - much like a painter mixing his set of colours, helping to fill the canvas and establish the main tones. This happened live as the user recorded their audio, allowing them to see a direct one-to-one representation. Multiple brushes were used where their size and colour were directly controlled by the sound frequencies. For example, low frequency sounds were a deep blue whilst high frequency sounds took on a more orange to red colour. The volume of the input also affected the brush application, where the louder the audio, the larger the brushes.

data.title: Step 2: Applying the Brushes
data.body: Once the background phase was complete, we wanted to add a human touch and sense of movement. This was done by displacing the background, using a set of ten unique brushes. By digitally pushing and pulling the colour of the background in a diagonal direction, we were able to mix colours and achieve the sense of brush strokes.

data.title: Sharing and Printing
data.body: After viewing their final art result, the user was provided multiple options to engage in the campaign concept of giving. Firstly the user could share their artwork on Twitter, Facebook or download an image to post on Instagram. Additionally, the user could download a high resolution printable PDF version to print themselves or print their artwork on canvas. By utilizing a third party printing provider, we were able to generate an artwork at a quality ready for a canvas print.

data.title: Creating a High Resolution Version
data.body: The rendering of the artwork on the website is created at a standard web resolution which would not be high enough for a user to print on paper. To create the high resolution version we built a back end system on a server using a high end graphics card to replicate the front end visuals. When a user recorded audio and created an artwork, all of the colour data, brushes, positional information and brush strokes were stored in a JSON file. This file was then sent to the back end and recreated at a much high resolution.

projects.title: Did You Mean MailChimp?
projects.description: Did You Mean MailChimp? is a digital multiverse that says hello to the world in a uniquely MailChimp way - with confidence, creativity and a little bit of weirdness.

data.title: The Campaign
data.body: It's not every day that you get invited to an interactive party to create digital playthings that are visceral, unexpected, delightful and downright weird - it's always a breath of fresh air to have a brand willing to do things differently. In 2014, MailChimp struck marketing gold when a 13-year-old girl mispronounced their name 'MailKimp' on the cult podcast Serial. This inspired a collection of cultural activations that captured people's imaginations around the world. From interactive music videos to whale synthesisers, we crafted nine digital experiences, creating an eclectic multiverse where everything sounds like MailChimp.

data.title: Cannes Grand Prix Winner
data.body: There aren't many awards as prestigious as the Cannes Cyber Lion Grand Prix, and to win this with our friends at MailChimp and Droga5 is an absolute honour. A massive thanks to MailChimp for the audacity and commitment to create something truly memorable, and to Droga5 for the creative partnership and collaboration throughout this ambitious project. We definitely mean MailChimp!

projects.title: Zero Landfill
projects.description: To raise awareness of Subaru's environmental history, we turned the classic timeline into a perfect visual metaphor: the rings of a tree.

data.title: Helping the Environment
data.body: Zero Landfill showcases over ten years of Subaru's environmental initiatives and its work with American National Parks.

data.title: User Experience
data.body: We created unique user interactions. The reactive tree rings respond by unfolding into a timeline, with simulated organic motion. The two simplified navigation modes make it easy to find relevant information, allowing users to search by time and by category.

data.title: Mobile
data.body: A mobile exclusive version of the site was optimized for the specific needs of mobile users, without compromising on the beautiful design.

projects.title: adidas Originals
projects.description: Resn's evolving collaboration with adidas Originals has produced a series of eye-popping microsites for numerous Originals' collections. Each site reflected the themes and designs of the collection with playful and surprising moments.

data.title: adidas ZX Flux
data.body: adidas ZX Flux ecomm site? Check. Sweet graphics? Check. Millennial models looking cool? Check. Baller micro-site animations? Big animated check.

data.title: adidas NMD_
data.body: A great big scoop of urban noir dripping with light phantasma to showcase the 2017 NMD_ products and looks. Delish.

data.title: Shop the Look
data.body: Integrated e-shop experiences with clear and relevant CTAs to purchase are seamlessly integrated throughout the sites. Shopping the look has never been easier.

projects.title: McWhopper
projects.description: For Peace Day, Burger King invited McDonald's to put aside their beef and join forces to create the ultimate burger mashup.

data.title: The Idea
data.body: September 21st is the International Day of Peace. To raise awareness of Peace Day, Burger King made an unprecedented proposal to arch-rivals McDonaldâ€™s: join forces and create the McWhopper.

data.title: The Proposal
data.body: Resn teamed up with Y&R New Zealand to create McWhopper.com. The custom Tumblr experience was an open letter from Burger King to McDonald's, detailing every aspect of the Peace Day plan, from the co-branded designs to the recipe for the McWhopper itself.

data.title: The Burger
data.body: A synthesis of the restaurantsâ€™ signature burgers, the McWhopper combined the the best of the mouth-watering Whopper and the iconic Big Mac. The campaign hinged on the public wanting this burger, so we had to make it look as delicious as possible.

data.title: The Results
data.body: With over 2 billion web impressions and over 700,000 users on the website in the first 48 hours, the response exceeded all expectations. McWhopper was a huge win for Burger King and for Peace Day.

projects.title: adidas Kick Creator
projects.description: This was an installation inviting visitors to showcase their skills in a street-style football cage with two cameras spinning 360° around them. Once outside, a dynamic edit of their tricks is sent direct to their mobile device. Easily transportable - Kick Creator recently completed a tour of ten European cities.

data.title: Simple Sign Up
data.body: Queuing is made easy with a simple Resn-made iPad app. Each visitor enters the digital queue by supplying the host with their name, and email - information we need to deliver their video output. The host iPad also allows for full control of the installations recording system.

data.title: Enter The Cage
data.body: People enter the cage one at a time and have 60 seconds to perform their tricks. During this period a curtain is closed and LED lights animate inside, providing an exciting visual experience. Lighting colour changes on the floor and sides indicate when the recording sequence is complete.

data.title: Record / Generate / Email / Share
data.body: Once initiated by the host app, two cameras spin around the cage. One camera captures the top half of the creator’s trick and one focuses on the feet (and product). They both wirelessly send their recorded footage to our backend neatly hidden within the screen tower of the installation. This backend system generates an on-the-fly custom edit, exports, encodes and then emails it directly to the creator for immediate download and innumerable sharing opportunities.

data.title: Easily Transportable
data.body: The Kick Creator activation has travelled ten major European cities with ease, featuring a small physical footprint and a construction system that is easily packed down, transported and re-installed at new destinations.

projects.title: adidas Climachill
projects.description: Feel the burn with the latest from the adidas Climachill range.

data.title: Stay Frosty
data.body: This is the fifth collaboration in three years between Resn and the adidas Clima team. For this iteration, we supported the campaign's 'Not Made For Normal' aesthetic of heat and location based photography, by creating an evocative and fashion-centric, single scroll experience.

data.title: Getting In the Zone!
data.body: The Climazone Hub represents a first in our partnership with adidas: a digital repository to house the entire Clima range and its progressive roll-out over the whole year.

data.title: Cool Me Down!
data.body: We introduced subtle burn animations to the images and site transitions, enhancing the realistic and arid art direction.

projects.title: Converse Diamonds
projects.description: Wetropolis is a neon-tinged, future-soaked dystopia raining GIFs.
projects.role: Design, Animation, GIF Content Creation, Development

data.title: Welcome to Wetropolis
data.body: Resn was asked to showcase the cutting-edge, water resistance features of the new Converse Chuck IIâ€™s by creating an interactive music video featuring a 23 year old Korean rapping superstar, Keith Ape. The result is Converse Diamonds, our WebGL-saturated, interactive music video, made in partnership wih Anomaly and BRTHR.

data.title: Acid Rain
data.body: To make a psychadelic interactive experience, we unleashed a flood of user-activated hallucinogenic GIFs, leveraging unique in-camera shots and B-roll footage from the music video shoot. The cherry on top? Innovative real-time water effects using a displacement map as a fragment shader. Make it rain!

data.title: We Got Wet, So You Don't Have To
data.body: To optimise performance for every region and every device, we used a progressive download for the video with a small preloader for assets. We used multiple CDNâ€™s to keep download speeds fast, wherever in the world you happen to be.

data.title: Mobile Fluidity
data.body: One of the biggest challenges we faced was enabling the video to display the water effects in-browser on a mobile device using iOS - without compromising performance. We also built a custom online platform to deliver our GIFs and allow users to activate them using a mobile device.

projects.title: adidas Originals Tumblr
projects.description: A complete overhaul of the Adidas Originals Tumblr blog. We hijacked Tumblr’s flexible API to allow adidas to tell their stories in a new and innovative way.

data.title: A Revolutionary Approach
data.body: We revolutionised the adidas Originals Tumblr, delivering a fully customised, story-driven interface that allowed adidas full control over the stories they want to tell. It was a huge success for Originals, generating massive online traffic and revamping brand direction.

data.title: Social Made Simple
data.body: To allow for quicker navigation and more content, we used a combination of horizontal and vertical scroll. Users could purchase any item they saw, with one-click links to the adidas Originals store. The simple content management system gave adidas secure, in-house control over all the content.

projects.title: adidas Speedfactory
projects.description: The global launch of the AM4 series features advanced footwear made for and releasing in London, Paris, New York City, Tokyo and Shanghai. Tailored to city. Optimized to athlete. Here to create.

data.title: AM4
data.body: Adidas' sport science data turned into design.

data.title: AM4LDN
data.body: Digitally Crafted. Perfected for the commute.

data.title: AM4PAR
data.body: Digitally Crafted. Perfected for the long run.

data.title: AM4NYC
data.body: Digitally Crafted. Perfected for speed.

data.title: AM4LA
data.body: Digitally Crafted. For the oceans.

data.title: AM4SH
data.body: Digitally Crafted. Perfected for power.

data.title: AM4TKY
data.body: Digitally Crafted. Perfected for the city.

projects.title: Karenina - The Live Edition
projects.description: We partnered with Google Russia and SLAVA to take a masterpiece of Russian literature and reinterpret it for the Digital Age. The result was a live-streamed reading marathon and interactive exploration of Leo Tolstoy's legendary novel, Anna Karenina.

data.title: A Living Novel
data.body: We created a brand new edition of Anna Karenina using the real voices of the Russian people. Over 700 narrators participated in a 36 hour, live-streamed reading marathon of Anna Karenina on Google Hangouts. We took the narration videos and created a brand new, online edition of the novel, searchable by narrator, location and theme.

data.title: Worldwide Reach
data.body: Karenina -The Live Edition was a modern tribute to Leo Tolstoy's enduring masterpiece. The project received massive media attention, reaching three quarters of Russian internet users and viewers from 106 countries. It set a Guinness World Record for the largest audience for a live-streamed reading marathon.

projects.title: Digit Duel
projects.description: Digit Duel is a game made for the launch of the Leap Motion controller, a device which lets you operate your PC using hand gestures. A quick and steady hand is the only thing that can save you from the meanest bunch of good-for-nothin' outlaws this side of the Rio Grande.

data.title: A Digital Showdown
data.body: Face off against the Wild West's worst weirdos. Your hand is your trusty six-shooter. Just draw, point and shoot. The zero-latency of the Leap Motion makes it easy to go from greenhorn to the fastest gun in the West. If you're lucky, you'll make it past sundown. If you ain’t, you’d better learn to breathe through that new hole in your head.

data.title: Bold Design
data.body: Digit Duel's bold, poster-style design is set against the classic Old West motif. The promotional website highlighted the game's bold graphics, western themes, and Morricone-inspired soundtrack.

projects.title: Dim-Sum
projects.description: Dim-Sum is a heaping plateful of experimental nibbles with piping hot centres. Get lost in this Tumblr-hacked, digital smorgasbord of insanity.

data.title: Life's an Experiment
data.body: Experimentation is part of the job. Prototypes, experiments and webtoys, oh my!

data.title: Fantastic Voyage
data.body: There are 29 experiments to keep you entertained for hours, minutes or seconds. How long the entertainment lasts is enirely up to you and your attention span. Or lack thereof.

projects.title: Dove | Have Your Say
projects.description: Challenge how the media portrays women in sports.

data.title: When they only see an athlete's looks...
data.body: ...they don't see her at all. Every day, the media judges female athletes on their appearance. The more we focus on an athleteâ€™s appearance, the less we see her achievements and performance. To convey this, Resn used a visual metaphor: an athlete hidden behind a barrage of sexist media quotes.

data.title: Change the Story.
data.body: We're exposed to comments about female athetes' appearance hundreds of millions of times every year. It's enough to leave you speechless. Dove | Have Your Say encourages you to break your silence and to respond directly to sexist quotes on social media. It's time to let them know it's not okay.

data.title: Real Time Judgement Tracking.
data.body: The site tracks real-time media judgments of female athletesâ€™ appearance from digital publications, live broadcasts and radio commentary. This gives users the chance to respond to sexist comments immediately.

data.title: Live in New York.
data.body: Select video content and quotes from the website were displayed live in Times Square as well as in popular spots in LA and Toronto.

projects.title: Face Arcade
projects.description: Face Arcade gives you not none, not two, not even three, but four lifelike games! Use your face to control this cacophony of fast-paced and addictive mini-games. Compete with your Google Hangouts friends and emerge as the Face Arcade champion.

data.title: Face Off
data.body: Do you want to play games online, but get tired of all the cables? Using powerful Google and Resn technologies, you can now control games using only your face and a webcam.

data.title: Face-to-face-to-face-to-face!
data.body: Best of all, Google Hangouts lets you play against your friends all across the world with internet technology. Battle them face-to-face without the awkwardness of being in the same room as another human being!

projects.title: Flash Driving Game
projects.description: Can a personal experience of death change the way youth think about speeding? To test this idea, we developed a high-octane racing game with an unexpected twist. Flash Driving Game was part of NZTA's “Safer Journeys” initiative, targeting young drivers.

data.title: Unexpected Twist
data.body: Targeting young drivers, Flash Driving Game was launched as a console-style racer. With its pounding dubstep soundtrack and high-end graphics, Flash starts like any other racing game. But, after a few minutes of racing the game ends in a dramatic twist, as the player loses control of the vehicle and crashes. In their final moments, they literally see their life flash before their eyes as pictures of themselves and their loved ones appear on screen.

data.title: Game Over
data.body: For the crash sequence, we developed an algorithm that selects and displays emotionally-salient images from the player's own Facebook albums. As the screen fades to black, they are confronted with the message: 'You only get one life. Slow down.' To really bring it home, the game can only be played once.

projects.title: Hennessy: Never Stop, Never Settle
projects.description: In Cognac, France, where Hennessy is made, it is said that success comes from chasing the elusive Wild Rabbit. Our challenge was to inspire people to pursue their Wild Rabbit and encourage them to Never Stop, Never Settle.

data.title: What's Your Wild Rabbit?
data.body: Never Stop Never Settle is an immersive journey of self-discovery, set inside a fully-explorable, monochromatic dreamscape. With three inspiring storylines, featuring the talents of Martin Scorsese, Erykah Badu and Manny Pacquiao, we asked users, 'What's Your Wild Rabbit?'

data.title: Rapid Previs
data.body: During the project, we developed a proprietary system that allowed our animators to rapidly adjust and preview animations and 3D camera movements. The result was an interactive, cinematic journey to discover the mythical Wild Rabbit.

projects.title: KIA Techathlete Games
projects.description: How do you engage users enough to explain all the unique tech features of the 2014 Kia Forte? We developed five games, controlled in five different ways, to show off the technology packed car.

data.title: Play Five Ways
data.body: We took the top-five tech features of the Kia Forte and created a game around each one. Users played each of the five games using different input method: keyboard, mouse, smartphone, webcam, and microphone. To maximize the sharing potential, the entire Techathlete experience was played within Facebook.

projects.title: Life-Size Messi
projects.description: Our challenge was to build the world’s first life-size human being, right inside your browser, to promote EA SPORTS™ FIFA 14. So, we created LE0, a living, breathing, true-to-life avatar of Lionel Messi.

data.title: Designing an Avatar
data.body: Using 3D scans and high-resolution photographs, we constructed LE0 using 752 bones, 75 megapixels of textures, 150,000 polygons and 60MB of data. We breathed life into LE0 through real-time, interactive, 3D animations and our own proprietary AI logic. To handle the unprecedented scale and detail of our 3D models and animations, we developed a fully-customized 3D pipeline.

projects.title: Cheetos: Project TP
projects.description: Project TP is Cheetos' mission to cover every house on Earth in toilet paper, digitally. Join Cheetos mascot Chester Cheetah in this fun, interactive Halloween adventure.

data.title: An Animated Adventure
data.body: In Project TP, users could cover any house in the world with toilet paper. We used the Google Maps API to let users select an address. An animated bombing raid, featuring Chester Cheetah, provided a storyline and elevated this point-and-click experience to an adventure.

data.title: 2D or not 2D?
data.body: For the final reveal, we used Google Streetview to get a close-up of the address covered in streams of toilet paper. To achieve this, we developed a depth and edge detection algorithm that allowed the 3D toilet paper to drape naturally over the 2D Streetview objects.

projects.title: PS4: Gamer Masterpiece
projects.description: Gamer Masterpiece gave gamers the tools to immortalize themselves in a painting, surrounded by their favourite PS4 characters, and submit it for votes and prizes.

data.title: Create a Masterpiece
data.body: We designed a tool to let users immortalize themselves in an artistic masterpiece. Our artists recreated three historic paintings, with 70 interchangeable elements from 20 different game titles. Users could quickly create a painting, then upload their own face and blend it, seamlessly, into their masterpiece.

data.title: Share, Vote and Win!
data.body: Face-detection and post-moderation enabled all users to safely share their creations on desktop, tablet and even the PS4. We developed a head-to-head voting system where paintings battled it out for votes. Top users won prizes, including PS4s and real prints of their Gamer Masterpiece.

projects.title: REI 1440 Project
projects.description: There are 1,440 minutes in a day. Every one is worth celebrating. We let fans of outdoor retailer REI collect and share their outdoor photography to fill every minute of an entire day with images.

data.title: Simple to Use
data.body: We used Facebook Connect for easy authentication and sharing, pulling in user-created content from Instagram. Photos were curated into a 24-hour timeline and clock interface. We developed a simple method for users to add the time, activity, location and descriptions to images, making it easy to get involved and share.

data.title: Embraced by Fans
data.body: The experience struck a chord with the REI user community who quickly filled the entire 1440 minutes. Users continue to add and share their photos, allowing the platform to outlast the initial campaign. To date, there are more than 3.5 million Instagram posts tagged #rei1440project (and counting!).

projects.title: Resn Legacy Website
projects.description: Hailed as the greatest website of all time, it mysteriously vanished for a crime that doesn't exist. Still wanted by the government, it now roams the shadowy underbelly of the dank web, protecting the innocent from the evil forces of Smellator.

data.title: Flash Flashback
data.body: Back when Flash ruled the internet, the old Resn site was often imitated but never equalled. It stood as a beacon of hope for the creatively oppressed and a symbol of peace for anyone who dreamed of a world where swans, wolves and vampire bats could live together in harmony.

projects.title: Resn's Little Helper
projects.description: A long time ago, before St. Nick, Father Christmas, Kris Kringle, Santa or whatever you wanna call him, there was an elf, some ’shrooms and a flute. The real first Christmas. Truth.

data.title: Beautiful Music
data.body: Resn's Little Helper is an award-winning, musical experience that incorporates only the finest instruments and the most beautiful notes available to us at the time. We hope it will give aural pleasure to Christmas lovers for generations to come.

projects.title: SBTRKT: Look Away
projects.description: SBTRKT: Look Away was the world's first interactive music video to use a webcam and facial recognition software.

data.title: Mysterious Woman
data.body: This compelling, interactive music video evokes the atmosphere of SBTRKT's enigmatic track, 'Look Away'. Inspired by the song's lyrics, the music video features a mysterious female face, that reacts to the viewer. We inserted visual glitches, resembling an malfunctioning CRT television, to create an experience that was unsettling and strange.

data.title: Interactive Creepshow
data.body: Pitchfork called it 'uncanny'. Stereogum said it was 'a strange interactive experience'. Videostatic called it an 'interactive creepshow that's a perfect fit for this haunting track'. Whatever you call it, Look Away is an eerie interactive art-piece that captures the essence of SBTRKT's 'Look Away'.

projects.title: Sponsafier
projects.description: Sponsifier let NASCAR fans design their own custom cup car in 3D, for NASCAR Team Toyota drivers. The winner got to see their car on the track at the 2010 NASCAR Sprint All-Star Race.

data.title: Custom Cup Cars
data.body: The Sponsafier campaign lasted for two NASCAR seasons, with four different iterations. Sponsifier let fans design custom cup cars for NASCAR Team Toyota drivers. The winner got the chance to hang out with their favourite driver.

projects.title: Threaded
projects.description: Idea: An experiment in the transference of artificial intelligence to a human vessel in order for said AI to experience tactile response from external real-world stimuli. Target market: All sentient mammalian bipeds of all age designations and social stratification.

data.title: Resn_will_stab_you
data.body: Our Approach: Phase 1: Use gentle persuasion and reward through new gamification prototypes. Phase 2: Forcibly take control of subject's mind sack. Phase 3: Go for a nice walk along the beach in our newly acquired body.

projects.title: Wildflower
projects.description: Grow a unique Wildflower and send it to someone special. Let users experience the creation of a unique virtual object and to share it with someone special for Valentine's Day.

data.title: A Wild Bloom
data.body: Wildflower generates an animated WebGL flower, which blooms just like the real thing.  To ensure each Wildflower is unique, we use numerous randomized elements, including the size, number, shape, arrangement, and colour of the petals.

data.title: Spread the Love
data.body: Users can grow as many Wildflowers as they like and share them with their loved ones. It quickly developed a fanbase and spread virally, worldwide, over Valentine's Day, 2015.

projects.title: adidas Originals Lookbook
projects.description: A kaleidoscopic lookbook celebrating the collaboration between adidas Originals and Brazilian brand The FARM Company for the Spring/Summer season of 2014.

projects.title: adidas EQT
projects.description: BRAND: adidas Originals. // PRODUCT: No bulls**t exploration of new EQT range. // STRATEGY: Everything that is essential. Nothing that is not.

data.title: EQT FW17
data.body: A minimalist exploration of the adidas Originals EQT line.

data.title: EQT Basketball
data.body: Delivered for the sneakerhead's merging street style with legendary sports heritage.

projects.title: 26000 Vodka
projects.description: Explore the purity of New Zealand vodka made from 26000-year-old water. An expansive 3D experience that will immerse you in one of the world's finest vodkas.

data.title: Pure
data.body: Users entered a custom-built, 3D environment, where they floated through an icy cavern, surrounded by drops of crystalline water. The sparse, soothing audio reflected and the site's seductive imagery of glacial ice and pure ingredients that go into every handmade batch distillation.
Batch distilled 26000 Vodka is the only premium vodka brand made in the antipodes.

projects.title: Panera Land of Clean
projects.description: The Panera Land of Clean is a most delicious adventure, but watch out for those pesky No-Nos.
projects.role: Design, Animation, Illustration, Content Creation, Development

data.title: Find the No-Nos
data.body: Panera's commitment to clean food means they're eliminating ingredients from artificial sources before the end of the 2016. They asked us create a game that would highlight their efforts to remove these ingredients. It had to be fun, engaging, informative and, of course, look absolutely delicious.

data.title: An Edible World
data.body: Resn meticulously built and painstakingly animated the 'Panera Land of Clean', with the help of renowned food artist Carl Warner. The result was a beautiful, tranquil and delicious world made entirely of foods from the Panera pantry.

data.title: From Practical to Digital
data.body: The three levels were created practically, then broken up into pieces and animated digitally. The levels were part of the larger ‘Land of Clean’ which served as the site's map and access point to the levels - through gorgeous, seamless transitioning.

projects.title: League of Legends: Worlds History
projects.description: Access the illustrious history of the League of Legends World Championship through the very thing the players covet above all else - The Summoner's Cup!

data.title: A Premier Event
data.body: Riot Games asked Resn to create an interactive timeline for the League of Legends World Championship, to track its rise to become one of the premier events in all of eSports. We drew on the rich content from the brief but glorious five-year history of the event, to inspire appreciation for its growth and accomplishments.

data.title: The Summoner's Cup
data.body: Resn centred the experience around the Summoner's Cup - the trophy competitors fight for at the World Championship. Users can spin a 3D Summoner's Cup to navigate through the history of the tournament from 2011 to 2016.

data.title: A Chrononautical Journey
data.body: After choosing a date from the timeline, lights project from the cup to illuminate the year and title. Users can explore each year in a scrollable layout of content, connected with animated constellation lines, consistent with the galactic theme throughout the site.

projects.title: KFC Hall of Colonels
projects.description: Welcome to the Hall of Colonels, a journey into Colonel Sanders' legendary past.

data.title: History's Greatest Chicken Chef
data.body: In this virtual animatronic museum, youâ€™ll find games, music, theatre and a whole lot more. From fistfights to shootouts, youâ€™ll learn facts about the Colonelâ€™s life you wonâ€™t believe. Itâ€™s like a boring history lesson without the boring.

data.title: Real Fake
data.body: In a fit of hubris, we decided to make physical objects. Yes, we made non-digital things! Things you can feel. Or rub up against. Or poke with a stick. We know, it's weird. With the help of some special effects make-up artists, we recreated the head of Colonel Sanders three times: one young, one old and one bronze. The last one was to represent the deceased Colonel (because somehow it seemed too soon for a zombie version). Colonel Sanders might not have lived to see the digital age, but a phalanx of his prosthetic lookalikes is the next best thing.

data.title: Colonel Quest
data.body: The taste of KFC reminds us of a simpler time. Like the Great Depression, for instance (which, apparently, wasn't all that great), or the 1980s (which totally was). In our case, it was the era of classic console games. Which is why we made Colonel Quest - an epic cycle of six 8-bit games based on true events from the Colonel's life. Forget your over-engineered modern controllers, these games are played with just two buttons. Theyâ€™re finger clickin' good.

data.title: Drumstick Gaming
data.body: To promote the site, we made game controllers out of real imitation chicken drumsticks and sent them to high profile influencers. Most of them were just confused, but some people thought they were awesome. And the second sort of people were right.

projects.title: Chekhov is Alive
projects.description: We took one of the greatest writers of 19th century and brought his work to life with the technology of the 21st.

data.title: Which Character Are You?
data.body: Chekhov Is Alive is an online character quiz and audition created for a marathon livestreamed reading event of Anton Chekhov's plays. The website featured animated illustrations of 28 of Chekhovâ€™s classic characters, wrapped in a playful material design.

data.title: A Livestreamed Reading
data.body: After taking the quiz, users were able to record and submit an audition to become part of the 24 hour livestreamed reading of Chekhov. During the reading, 700 people performed Chekov on 25 stages, from New York to Yuzhno-Sakhalinsk.

data.title: Unprecedented Response
data.body: The unprecedented media attention and public interest resulted in massive site traffic and millions of viewers for the livestreaming event. The project breathed life into Chekhov's works and brought him a new generation of fans.

data.title: Results
data.body: We had 1 million+ site visits, 528,990 took the online test and 850 recorded a video audition. There were 5.4 billion media impressions, 6 million views of promo video, and 3 million playbacks of the livestream. The Google+ page got 20,000 followers and 4 million impressions, while Google searches for Chekhov increased fourfold, after project was announced.

projects.title: Las Fantasticas Aventuras
projects.description: A custom Tumblr showcasing a series of user-inspired films for the release of the new Ford Focus.

data.title: Engaging the Audience
data.body: Las Fantásticas Aventuras was an elegant repository for a user-influenced web series, featuring the 2015 Ford Focus. Aimed at U.S. Hispanic millennials, the campaign set out to subvert familiar tropes and traditional stereotypes, with video content taking centre stage and users deciding the direction of the story.

data.title: User Generated Content
data.body: We were tasked to create a site that would inspire users to participate in the campaign. A custom form allowed users to write and submit their scripts for upcoming chapters. The most compelling ideas were selected and a new chapter was filmed and released every two weeks.

data.title: UGC = User Generated Coolness
data.body: We received over two thousand story submissions over the course of the campaign. From zombie luchadores to a daring chicken rescue, users took the film in directions nobody had imagined. Most of our site visitors stayed for the videos and we gained thousands of dedicated fans who faithfully came back to watch new chapters.

projects.title: The Self-Destructing Book
projects.description: James Patterson is the worldâ€™s #1 bestselling author. His latest book, 'Private Vegas', is about to self-destruct.

data.title: The Most Thrilling Read Ever
data.body: For the launch of James Patterson's 'Private Vegas', Resn and Mother New York wanted to make sure the experience was as exhilarating as possible. To do this, we created the Self-Destructing Book, an electrifying, digitally augmented thrill-ride, befitting the Master of Suspense.

data.title: Design & Experience
data.body: We developed an iPad-exclusive version of the book, complete with animated thrills at key moments in the action. Through our website, we gave away 1,000 copies to lucky winners, who had 24 hours to read the book before it self-destructed. To ensure only the winners could access it, we created a unique code for every copy and released them in batches over five days.

data.title: Dramatic Tension
data.body: We designed every aspect of our app to heighten the tension of the reading experience. As the story unfolds, blood splatters across the screen. Smoke obscures the text. Hidden messages appear. Police sirens wail. Explosions envelop the page. In every possible way, we put readers directly into the action.

data.title: It's a Sabotage!
data.body: After entering the access code, the countdown begins. As a constant reminder, a timer counts down every second, until the very last. To connect site visitors to the reading experience, we let them steal time from our winners. Users were connected in real-time to our readers via the hub. By clicking the 'Sabotage Timer' button, they could steal fifteen minutes of reading time, heightening the tension and forcing winners to read fastr.

projects.title: belVita #MorningWin
projects.description: With Belvita #MorningWin, we gave users personalized websites that lasted four hours, featuring a selection of crazy, bite-sized games.

data.title: Four Hours of Fun
data.body: Released as part of Droga5's belVita Breakfast Bites campaign, we made 15 absurdly interactive games and webtoys. Users who tweeted the #MorningWin hashtag received a link to a website with a selection of games, personalized with their tweet, Twitter handle, and profile picture. Since belVita Bites give you four hours of energy, the website lasted four hours before it disappeared.

data.title: A Collaborative Collaboration
data.body: The highly collaborative creative process saw both Resn and Droga5 pitching game ideas. We tabled any suggestion, as long as it sounded sufficiently absurd. After selecting the strongest concepts, we turned them into silly pictures. Then we threw away the worst pictures and punished those responsible. Careers and lives were lost in the process. Also, limbs.

data.title: Metaphysical Sump Thing Something
data.body: From twisting characters into impossible yoga poses to protecting random objects from being stolen by a kleptomaniac eagle, belVita #Morning Win was the result of purging our collective unconsciousness of its repressed metaphysical desires and depositing them onto the substrate of the digital plane. Or something.

projects.title: Play Your Stripes
projects.description: Resn and Wieden+Kennedy New York partnered to create Gap: Play Your Stripes, an augmented reality experience that turns your winter wardrobe into a musical masterpiece.

data.title: Musical Clothing
data.body: Our challenge was to let users put on an ordinary striped outfit, stand in front of a webcam, and start making music. It had to be simple, intuitive, and fun. Part of Gapâ€™s Holiday Gift Guide, Play Your Stripes features the song â€˜It Is What It Isâ€™ and tracks by Disasteradio.

data.title: Rapid Problem Solving
data.body: A technology discovery phase allowed us to quickly experiment with different approaches to solve a complex creative problem. To find the best approach, we developed a range of prototypes exploring stripe detection, hand tracking, sample triggering, beat quantizing and audio mixing.

data.title: Detecting Stripes and Hands
data.body: Our proprietary Smart Stripe Detection Systemâ„¢ analyses colour changes within the image to locate the boundaries of stripes and define the areas that the user can play. To detect hands, we analyse differences in lightness values on the webcam feed. Frame-to-frame, we track user movement and use blob detection to determine the position of the user's hands and detect which stripes they are touching.

data.title: Audio Mixing
data.body: Music is dynamically mixed, in real-time. This ensures the audio tracks are in sync with each other and the video. Recorded audio is spliced with the userâ€™s video so they that they can share it on their social networks.

projects.title: Way of the Desperados
projects.description: Way of the Desperados. With GIFs from pixel wizards near and far. So drop the sanity act. Put your face in it. And let your pupils party.

data.title: GIFtastic
data.body: Way of the Desperados is an interactive Tumblr experience like no other. The unexpected and surprising GIFs are paired with random rollovers of variable speed, rotation, and scale.

data.title: A Fluid Experience
data.body: Our top priority was silky-smooth UX. As you scroll through the page, textures are uploaded and removed. To increase the performance, we used the GPU to accelerate the native scroll and to move and animate elements on the page.

data.title: Structured Creativity
data.body: We used the Tumblr API to create a flexible front end. We mirror the page structure to maintain a cohesion between the experience and the base API, giving us creative freedom within the Tumblr platform.

data.title: High Performance
data.body: Our biggest challenge was enabling users to scroll through an unlimited number of GIFs without compromising performance. The solution was to use a static image when the page is scrolling, then replace it with a GIF when it stops.

projects.title: Evinrude E-TEC G2
projects.description: We introduce you to the worldâ€™s most advanced outboard engine, the Evinrude E-TEC G2, and give you the tools to design your own.

data.title: Breakthrough Design
data.body: Choose Your E-TEC makes the Evinrude E-TEC G2 come to life. Learn all about the engine and explore its breakthrough features. Then, design your own with the simple and intuitive Customizer.

data.title: Frame Loading
data.body: With 264 frames in the About sequence, our challenge was to provide a high-quality experience with minimal wait time. Before we let users in, we load the first frame in high-resolution and half the other frames in medium-resolution. Afterward, we continue to improve the frame quality in the background.

data.title: The E-TEC Journey
data.body: Dynamic camera movements take you through an animated sequence that shows the full extent of the engine, inside and out. So as you journey through the site, the engine moves with you, revealing new angles and layers that show-off its breakthrough design.

data.title: Customizer Tool
data.body: Customize an E-TEC G2 by selecting its horsepower and designing its colour scheme. Rotate the engine for a complete 360° view of the final result. Once you’ve perfected the design, you can download a dynamic PDF of your engine’s specifications and share it on social media.
